<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Update nrdb-horsepower-under-hood.mdx
username_0: Updated as per instructions in training üòÉ

<!-- Thanks for contributing to our docs! Your changes will help thousands of
New Relic users around the world. -->

<!-- Fill out this template to help us review your changes and route them to the
best team. See our [README.md](https://github.com/newrelic/docs-website/) for 
information on how to contribute. -->

### Tell us why

Explain why you're proposing this change. If there's an existing GitHub issue 
related to your change, please link to it.

### Anything else you'd like to share?

Add any context that will help us review your changes such as testing notes,
links to related docs, screenshots, etc. 

### Are you making a change to site code?

If you're changing site code (rather than the content of a doc), please follow
[conventional commit standards](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) 
in your commit messages and pull request title.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Appeal to Remove API Limits and Get Support Towards Hosted Instance of Staticman
username_0: Is it possible to maybe liaison with GitHub/GitLab to remove API limits? This will be more convenient than hosting one's own instance.

Also, get sponsorship from them or another provider supporting static sites towards the Staticman site hosting if hosting bandwidth and power is a limiting factor.
<issue_comment>username_1: The issue is not an API limit from GitHub. The reason the public instance was discontinued was that it was hosted on the free tier of Heroku which has low usage limit. With multiple people trying to use the same public instance, we quickly exhausted the limits of that Heroku tier. This is a community project with no funding so unless we find someone to pay for a public instance, the best alternative is to streamline the Staticman setup process and encourage users to host their own free instance.

Sponsorship is something we are open to, however I currently do not have the time to go out and search for such a sponsor.
<issue_comment>username_0: You can just ask Heroku to remove the limits. If they do then great win for everyone.
<issue_comment>username_1: Heroku is a business and has no incentive to offer us unlimited free hosting for nothing in return. We don't really have any leverage in this situation.
<issue_comment>username_0: You can put a sponsored by Heroku on the website and the readme.
<issue_comment>username_0: Companies like GitHub, GitLab, Zeit, Netlify may have the incentive to host it as this will increase adaptation of their services and will be added benefit to their clients.
<issue_comment>username_1: As mentioned before, I personally don't currently have the time to seek out such potential sponsorships so this is not something I plan to pursue. This project is currently in a kind of a maintenance mode where I attempt to get to critical bug fixes in a timely manner but don't have the bandwidth to add features and expand the project further right now. If we get some more maintainers and development of this project picks up steam, then I think we would be in a better position to seek sponsorship. If anyone is interested in such a role, we will happily accept contributions.

Having a sponsor places certain expectations on the project (especially regarding feature development) and this is just not something we're in a position to commit to at this time.
<issue_comment>username_2: With the one-click deploy button and the updated tutorials, hosting on a free-tier Heroku should be incredibly convenient with no installation at all.

Take Git*'s API limit as the fuse box of your floor.  In case of a short circuit (say sœÅŒ±m), the circuit has to be cut.  As a commenting service hosted on a particular instance can be used by everyone, this safety guard has to be put in place.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Deprecate class allocators and deallocators
username_0: `delete` was deprecated in 2.079.  Before the `delete` keyword can be removed it will be necessary to also deprecate and remove class allocators and deallocators.  They have been planned for deprecation for years; this PR finally puts the deprecation process in motion.

See https://dlang.org/deprecate.html#Class%20allocators%20and%20deallocators

DMD PR:  https://github.com/dlang/dmd/pull/8042
<issue_comment>username_1: So we recently found `@disable new` is actually kinda cool....
<issue_comment>username_0: Please elaborate.
<issue_comment>username_1: ```
struct S
{
  @disable new (size_t s) { return null; }
}

void main()
{
	S* s = new S; //  Error: allocator `e.S.new` is not callable because it is annotated with @disable
}
```
<issue_comment>username_1: So the application there is you can force users to go through your custom factory functions, or in the case of structs, put them on the stack (or bypass with memcpy lol).
<issue_comment>username_2: See https://github.com/dlang/phobos/pull/6003 for an example.
<issue_comment>username_0: I've added support for the syntax `@disable new();` to the DMD PR.  You won't even need to add the useless `size_t` argument.  That should prevent any breaking changes.
<issue_comment>username_1: That sounds good to me!
<issue_comment>username_0: Great!  If you don't mind, and truly approve of this PR, please take the explicit step of marking it "Approved".
<issue_comment>username_1: oh lol i keep forgetting i actually have some power in this repo. I don't have such power over on the dmd side though.
<issue_comment>username_0: I still think it's helpful to mark PRs "approved" even in repos where you may not have merge rights.  It helps to know that it was reviewed and scrutinized by anyone with D language skills, especially a veteran like yourself.
<issue_comment>username_3: Shouldn't this PR remove or mark as deprecated the respective sections in the spec too?
e.g.
https://dlang.org/spec/class.html#allocators
<issue_comment>username_0: I remember a brief discussion we had with one of the other deprecations in 2.079 to leave the spec in tact until removal (See https://github.com/dlang/dlang.org/pull/1941#issuecomment-364106970) so users could still refer to it when updating their code.  Therefore, since the spec has already marked allocators and deallocators as deprecated, I think the spec should be left it as is until removal.
<issue_comment>username_0: Ping!  DMD PR was merged.

column5: [{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'infominer33', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2020-10-23 20:01:14+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "hey! I really love staticman, thanks for all the hard work to those maintaining it! I've enabled encryption for the e-mail field and message field to use as a regular contact form.. now I'm trying to decrypt my first contact message sent thru staticman. first I tried: `openssl rsautl -decrypt -in /home/bob/encrypted -out /home/bob/decrypted -inkey /home/bob/.ssh/id_bot_rsa' outputs: ``` RSA operation error 139704754267456:error:0407109F:rsa routines:RSA_padding_check_PKCS1_type_2:pkcs decoding error:../crypto/rsa/rsa_pk1.c:251: 139704754267456:error:04065072:rsa routines:rsa_ossl_private_decrypt:padding check failed:../crypto/rsa/rsa_ossl.c:491: ``` then I found this post by username_3 about [Staticman's Encryption Mechanism](https://vincenttam.gitlab.io/post/2018-12-25-staticman-encryption-mechanism/) and try changing my decrypted message to base64 but getting a similar error cat encrypted | base64 -d | openssl rsautl -decrypt -oaep -out /home/bob/decrypted -inkey /home/bob/.ssh/id_bot_rsa ``` 140543979599168:error:04099079:rsa routines:RSA_padding_check_PKCS1_OAEP_mgf1:oaep decoding error:../crypto/rsa/rsa_oaep.c:262: 140543979599168:error:04065072:rsa routines:rsa_ossl_private_decrypt:padding check failed:../crypto/rsa/rsa_ossl.c:491: ``` I didn't realize it would be this hard, or I would have tried decrypting before I got my first submission to this contact form üòÖ I plan to do this in python eventually.. so, I'm not married to this openssl method if you have a suggestion in a different direction. any help appreciated", 'title': 'trouble decrypting encrypted comment fields', 'type': 'issue'} {'action': 'created', 'author': 'infominer33', 'comment_id': 715625723.0, 'datetime': '2020-10-23 23:04:57+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "Ok, trying again after finding RSA.js.. I copied it's contents to decrypt.js in the root of my staticman project folder, on the server where it's hosted and modified it for this purpose: ``` const NodeRSA = require('node-rsa') const key = new NodeRSA() key.importKey('-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\n Key found in config.production.json \n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----', 'private'); const decrypted = key.decrypt('539c27a0e4b4bfc25f45b2254245wergdsa10803f725', 'utf8'); console.log('decrypted: ', decrypted); ``` `node decrypt.js` outputs: ``` /home/bob/staticman/node_modules/node-rsa/src/NodeRSA.js:301 throw Error('Error during decryption (probably incorrect key). Original error: ' + e); ^ Error: Error during decryption (probably incorrect key). Original error: Error: Incorrect data or key at NodeRSA.module.exports.NodeRSA.$$decryptKey (/home/bob/staticman/node_modules/node-rsa/src/NodeRSA.js:301:19) at NodeRSA.module.exports.NodeRSA.decrypt (/home/bob/staticman/node_modules/node-rsa/src/NodeRSA.js:249:21) at Object. (/home/bob/staticman/decrypt.js:4:23) at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1137:30) at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1157:10) at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:985:32) at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:878:14) at Function.executeUserEntryPoint [as runMain] (internal/modules/run_main.js:71:12) at internal/main/run_main_module.js:17:47 ``` While it says probably incorrect key or data, but I've verified both, multiple times.", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'} {'action': 'created', 'author': 'infominer33', 'comment_id': 715651841.0, 'datetime': '2020-10-24 01:28:22+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "oh... well, I guess I was sorely mistaken about what I was doing... Unless I'm, yet again, mistaken, this setting in staticman config hashes the e-mail and the message, which is not a reversible action... which leads me to wonder. ``` transforms: email: md5 message: md5 ``` If that's the case, then the form asks for an e-mail address simply to make sure the user enters an e-mail, or is supposed to be used in conjunction with mailgun so you get the email address in a message sent you via mail?", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'} {'action': 'created', 'author': 'infominer33', 'comment_id': 715652309.0, 'datetime': '2020-10-24 01:31:57+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': "sigh.... https://github.com/eduardoboucas/staticman/issues/358 I don't suppose there's any server side logging?", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'} {'action': 'closed', 'author': 'infominer33', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2020-10-24 01:32:54+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'} {'action': 'created', 'author': 'hispanic', 'comment_id': 715906733.0, 'datetime': '2020-10-24 12:18:02+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': '@username_0 Sorry, but the logging is minimal-to-nonexistent. I was going to respond earlier that the result of the transform is a one-way hash that can't be reversed, but then you referenced that "Staticman's Encryption Mechanism" article and you made me doubt.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'} {'action': 'created', 'author': 'mocza', 'comment_id': 780195160.0, 'datetime': '2021-02-16 23:57:02+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_2', 'text': 'Hi, I keep getting a similar "oaep decoding error" as above in my browser console when I hit submit on a comment: _responseJSON: Object { success: false, rawError: "Error: Error during decryption (probably incorrect key). Original error: Error: error:04099079:rsa routines:RSA_padding_check_PKCS1_OAEP_mgf1:oaep decoding error" } I generated my RSA private key using: `ssh-keygen -m PEM -t rsa -b 4096 -C "staticman key" -f ~/.ssh/staticman_key` and I'm running my staticman instance on Heroku with RSA_PRIVATE_KEY config var set as: `heroku config:add --app staticman-instance-name "RSA_PRIVATE_KEY=$(cat ~/.ssh/staticman_key | tr -d '\n')"` My reCaptcha secret key was encrypted by my staticman instance using below URL form and has been populated in staticman.yml and _config.yml: https://${bridge_app_name}.herokuapp.com/v2/encrypt/{$recaptcha-secret} What am I missing?', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'} {'action': 'created', 'author': 'VincentTam', 'comment_id': 784347236.0, 'datetime': '2021-02-23 16:54:52+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_3', 'text': '@username_2 The output of cat ~/.ssh/staticman_key | tr -d '\n' lacks trailing `\n` as the 2nd part `tr -d '\n'` removed all newlines, including the trailing one. It seems that your API isn't happy about that. When I was testing #219 three years ago, its author advised me to use a modern code editor to replace all occurrences of the newline character `\n` with the string `\n`. (You may search the hidden discussion for the "missing RSA"). However, in Heroku deployment, that didn't work. I used heroku config:set RSA_PRIVATE_KEY="$(cat key.pem)" in my [API setup guide](https://vincenttam.gitlab.io/post/2018-09-16-staticman-powered-gitlab-pages/2/) written three years ago before the creation of the GitHub App authorization method. Recently, I've found an easier method in #402: just copy the contents of the PEM file and paste to the right text area for `RSA_PRIVATE_KEY` through Heroku's online dashboard. I suggest you upgrade to v3.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6: Title: trouble decrypting encrypted comment fields username_0: hey! I really love staticman, thanks for all the hard work to those maintaining it! I've enabled encryption for the e-mail field and message field to use as a regular contact form.. now I'm trying to decrypt my first contact message sent thru staticman. first I tried: `openssl rsautl -decrypt -in /home/bob/encrypted -out /home/bob/decrypted -inkey /home/bob/.ssh/id_bot_rsa' outputs: ``` RSA operation error 139704754267456:error:0407109F:rsa routines:RSA_padding_check_PKCS1_type_2:pkcs decoding error:../crypto/rsa/rsa_pk1.c:251: 139704754267456:error:04065072:rsa routines:rsa_ossl_private_decrypt:padding check failed:../crypto/rsa/rsa_ossl.c:491: ``` then I found this post by username_3 about [Staticman's Encryption Mechanism](https://vincenttam.gitlab.io/post/2018-12-25-staticman-encryption-mechanism/) and try changing my decrypted message to base64 but getting a similar error cat encrypted | base64 -d | openssl rsautl -decrypt -oaep -out /home/bob/decrypted -inkey /home/bob/.ssh/id_bot_rsa ``` 140543979599168:error:04099079:rsa routines:RSA_padding_check_PKCS1_OAEP_mgf1:oaep decoding error:../crypto/rsa/rsa_oaep.c:262: 140543979599168:error:04065072:rsa routines:rsa_ossl_private_decrypt:padding check failed:../crypto/rsa/rsa_ossl.c:491: ``` I didn't realize it would be this hard, or I would have tried decrypting before I got my first submission to this contact form üòÖ I plan to do this in python eventually.. so, I'm not married to this openssl method if you have a suggestion in a different direction. any help appreciated username_0: Ok, trying again after finding RSA.js.. I copied it's contents to decrypt.js in the root of my staticman project folder, on the server where it's hosted and modified it for this purpose: ``` const NodeRSA = require('node-rsa') const key = new NodeRSA() key.importKey('-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\n Key found in config.production.json \n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----', 'private'); const decrypted = key.decrypt('539c27a0e4b4bfc25f45b2254245wergdsa10803f725', 'utf8'); console.log('decrypted: ', decrypted); ``` `node decrypt.js` outputs: ``` /home/bob/staticman/node_modules/node-rsa/src/NodeRSA.js:301 throw Error('Error during decryption (probably incorrect key). Original error: ' + e); ^ Error: Error during decryption (probably incorrect key). Original error: Error: Incorrect data or key at NodeRSA.module.exports.NodeRSA.$$decryptKey (/home/bob/staticman/node_modules/node-rsa/src/NodeRSA.js:301:19) at NodeRSA.module.exports.NodeRSA.decrypt (/home/bob/staticman/node_modules/node-rsa/src/NodeRSA.js:249:21) at Object. (/home/bob/staticman/decrypt.js:4:23) at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1137:30) at Object.Module._extensions..js (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1157:10) at Module.load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:985:32) at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:878:14) at Function.executeUserEntryPoint [as runMain] (internal/modules/run_main.js:71:12) at internal/main/run_main_module.js:17:47 ``` While it says probably incorrect key or data, but I've verified both, multiple times. username_0: oh... well, I guess I was sorely mistaken about what I was doing... Unless I'm, yet again, mistaken, this setting in staticman config hashes the e-mail and the message, which is not a reversible action... which leads me to wonder. ``` transforms: email: md5 message: md5 ``` If that's the case, then the form asks for an e-mail address simply to make sure the user enters an e-mail, or is supposed to be used in conjunction with mailgun so you get the email address in a message sent you via mail? username_0: sigh.... https://github.com/eduardoboucas/staticman/issues/358 I don't suppose there's any server side logging? username_1: @username_0 Sorry, but the logging is minimal-to-nonexistent. I was going to respond earlier that the result of the transform is a one-way hash that can't be reversed, but then you referenced that "Staticman's Encryption Mechanism" article and you made me doubt. username_2: Hi, I keep getting a similar "oaep decoding error" as above in my browser console when I hit submit on a comment: _responseJSON: Object { success: false, rawError: "Error: Error during decryption (probably incorrect key). Original error: Error: error:04099079:rsa routines:RSA_padding_check_PKCS1_OAEP_mgf1:oaep decoding error" } I generated my RSA private key using: `ssh-keygen -m PEM -t rsa -b 4096 -C "staticman key" -f ~/.ssh/staticman_key` and I'm running my staticman instance on Heroku with RSA_PRIVATE_KEY config var set as: `heroku config:add --app staticman-instance-name "RSA_PRIVATE_KEY=$(cat ~/.ssh/staticman_key | tr -d '\n')"` My reCaptcha secret key was encrypted by my staticman instance using below URL form and has been populated in staticman.yml and _config.yml: https://${bridge_app_name}.herokuapp.com/v2/encrypt/{$recaptcha-secret} What am I missing? username_3: @username_2 The output of cat ~/.ssh/staticman_key | tr -d '\n' lacks trailing `\n` as the 2nd part `tr -d '\n'` removed all newlines, including the trailing one. It seems that your API isn't happy about that. When I was testing #219 three years ago, its author advised me to use a modern code editor to replace all occurrences of the newline character `\n` with the string `\n`. (You may search the hidden discussion for the "missing RSA"). However, in Heroku deployment, that didn't work. I used heroku config:set RSA_PRIVATE_KEY="$(cat key.pem)" in my [API setup guide](https://vincenttam.gitlab.io/post/2018-09-16-staticman-powered-gitlab-pages/2/) written three years ago before the creation of the GitHub App authorization method. Recently, I've found an easier method in #402: just copy the contents of the PEM file and paste to the right text area for `RSA_PRIVATE_KEY` through Heroku's online dashboard. I suggest you upgrade to v3.

column5:
[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'drorata', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2018-03-21 11:34:06+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'I tried to install `cookiecutter` and `jupyter_contrib_nbextensions` from `conda-forge`. In both cases, the last step in the plan was:

```
The following packages will be DOWNGRADED:

    conda:           4.5.0-py36_0                      --> 4.3.34-py36_0    conda-forge
```

Going forward with this ends up with a broken `conda` installation!!!

I opened an issue on https://github.com/ipython-contrib/jupyter_contrib_nbextensions/issues/1267 but I believe this is a more general problem given that it happens also with `cookiecutter`.', 'title': "Installing from conda-forge breaks conda's installation", 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'jankatins', 'comment_id': 374915386.0, 'datetime': '2018-03-21 12:07:12+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'Probably at some time fixed by https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-feedstock/pull/42', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'drorata', 'comment_id': 374921208.0, 'datetime': '2018-03-21 12:32:38+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '@username_1 What do you mean?', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'jankatins', 'comment_id': 374929176.0, 'datetime': '2018-03-21 13:04:17+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': "The problem is that conda prefers one channel over the other and will downgrade packages which are in a lower version of the preferred channel. In this case the default channel updated conda, but conda-forge has not yet done that. And you prefer the conda-forge channel above the default channel. 

There are probably also nowadays ways to pin a package to a channel or so. Haven't investigated yet...", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'CJ-Wright', 'comment_id': 374935503.0, 'datetime': '2018-03-21 13:27:00+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_2', 'text': 'Would it be possible to post the traceback for the conda error(s) you are getting? That might give us more info on what broke.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'jakirkham', 'comment_id': 374938659.0, 'datetime': '2018-03-21 13:36:57+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_3', 'text': 'Any reason not to use a different environment?', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'drorata', 'comment_id': 375221267.0, 'datetime': '2018-03-22 08:48:47+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': '@username_2 I am not sure what you mean. What errors? As mentioned in https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-feedstock/issues/43 `conda` is no longer available after the downgrade.

@username_3 I wanted to install `cookiecutter` on my base environment so it will be available across the board.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'dougalsutherland', 'comment_id': 375320726.0, 'datetime': '2018-03-22 14:13:32+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_4', 'text': '@username_0 The problem is the `conda` shell integration; your actual installation should still be okay. See the end of https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-feedstock/issues/43#comment-375152359 for instructions on how to work around the problem until we can get the new `conda` version on conda-forge.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'sdmcclure', 'comment_id': 404222443.0, 'datetime': '2018-07-11 15:59:12+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_5', 'text': 'Thanks for comments and help on this issue so far. I think I've run into the same problem, although I appear to have an up to date version of conda. Is there a way to restore conda on my machine (Windows with Anaconda distribution).

I had been using only default channels and installed the miktex package from conda-forge with:
conda install -c conda-forge miktex

This upgraded and downgraded several packages now conda is not working. conda list works, but conda search gives a loading channels error and conda upgrade gives an environment error.  Conda list shows that I have version 4.5.6 with conda-forge as the channel. I tried altering my condarc file (previously empty) and specifying default first, and then conda-forge. 

Is there a way to restore conda so that I can continue to use the default channel? I'm a reluctant to switch my primary channel to conda-forge until I learn more about it. I was unfamiliar with the concept of channels before I encountered this problem.

Here is the error report if that's helpfull:

"C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\conda\core\solve.py", line 180, in solve_final_state                                                                         index, r = self._prepare(prepared_specs) `conda install conda=4.6.14
`
It looks like further versions of conda are introducing this error.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Installing from conda-forge breaks conda's installation
username_0: I tried to install `cookiecutter` and `jupyter_contrib_nbextensions` from `conda-forge`. In both cases, the last step in the plan was:

```
The following packages will be DOWNGRADED:

    conda:           4.5.0-py36_0                      --> 4.3.34-py36_0    conda-forge
```

Going forward with this ends up with a broken `conda` installation!!!

I opened an issue on https://github.com/ipython-contrib/jupyter_contrib_nbextensions/issues/1267 but I believe this is a more general problem given that it happens also with `cookiecutter`.
<issue_comment>username_1: Probably at some time fixed by https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-feedstock/pull/42
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 What do you mean?
<issue_comment>username_1: The problem is that conda prefers one channel over the other and will downgrade packages which are in a lower version of the preferred channel. In this case the default channel updated conda, but conda-forge has not yet done that. And you prefer the conda-forge channel above the default channel. 

There are probably also nowadays ways to pin a package to a channel or so. Haven't investigated yet...
<issue_comment>username_2: Would it be possible to post the traceback for the conda error(s) you are getting? That might give us more info on what broke.
<issue_comment>username_3: Any reason not to use a different environment?
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_2 I am not sure what you mean. What errors? As mentioned in https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-feedstock/issues/43 `conda` is no longer available after the downgrade.

@username_3 I wanted to install `cookiecutter` on my base environment so it will be available across the board.
<issue_comment>username_4: @username_0 The problem is the `conda` shell integration; your actual installation should still be okay. See the end of https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-feedstock/issues/43#comment-375152359 for instructions on how to work around the problem until we can get the new `conda` version on conda-forge.
<issue_comment>username_5: Thanks for comments and help on this issue so far. I think I've run into the same problem, although I appear to have an up to date version of conda. Is there a way to restore conda on my machine (Windows with Anaconda distribution).

I had been using only default channels and installed the miktex package from conda-forge with:
conda install -c conda-forge miktex

This upgraded and downgraded several packages now conda is not working. conda list works, but conda search gives a loading channels error and conda upgrade gives an environment error.  Conda list shows that I have version 4.5.6 with conda-forge as the channel. I tried altering my condarc file (previously empty) and specifying default first, and then conda-forge. 

Is there a way to restore conda so that I can continue to use the default channel? I'm a reluctant to switch my primary channel to conda-forge until I learn more about it. I was unfamiliar with the concept of channels before I encountered this problem.

<issue_comment>username_6: https://github.com/conda/conda/issues/7524. Original issue is fixed now<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_5: @username_6 Thanks! This solution worked for me.
<issue_comment>username_7: I solve this problem installing the version 4.6.14 of conda as suggested on this issue [9004](https://github.com/conda/conda/issues/9004) before perform further installs.

`conda install conda=4.6.14
`
It looks like further versions of conda are introducing this error.

(It does not create a problem with ERC. It is an exception to avoid these pins to be global labels.)', 'title': '[KLC] better wording for stacking of power output, output and power input pins', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'closed', 'author': 'marekr', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2018-12-22 16:45:15+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': '', 'title': None, 'type': 'issue'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: [KLC] better wording for stacking of power output, output and power input pins
username_0: The wording for this exception is a bit strange. Right now it could be read that these should not be stacked while the intention is to only inform the reader that the invisible pins of such a stack should use the electrical type passive.

The reason for why this must be done is also wrong for power input. (It does not create a problem with ERC. It is an exception to avoid these pins to be global labels.)<issue_closed>

In psuedocode, something like this (taking $YEAR and $CITY as arguments or something)

```
hugo new events/$YEAR-$CITY/welcome.md --kind event
hugo new events/$YEAR-$CITY/program.md --kind event
hugo new events/$YEAR-$CITY/contact.md --kind event
hugo new events/$YEAR-$CITY/conduct.md --kind event
.
.
.
cp data/events/TEMPLATE.yml data/events/$YEAR-$CITY.yml
```', 'title': 'Create setup script for new events', 'type': 'issue'}

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Create setup script for new events
username_0: This is a low priority, but once we have the format down, we should create a pair of shell (and Powershell) scripts that can be used to generate a new event, taking in just the year and city name, etc.

In psuedocode, something like this (taking $YEAR and $CITY as arguments or something)

```
hugo new events/$YEAR-$CITY/welcome.md --kind event
hugo new events/$YEAR-$CITY/program.md --kind event
hugo new events/$YEAR-$CITY/contact.md --kind event
hugo new events/$YEAR-$CITY/conduct.md --kind event
.
.
.
cp data/events/TEMPLATE.yml data/events/$YEAR-$CITY.yml
```<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_1: Closing this, as I've done it.
